title.narrative: (Save the Children) Advancing access to healthcare and WASH amongst vulnerable and crisis-prone communities in Myanmar

description.narrative: Save the Children aims to improve the health status of highly vulnerable populations affected by marginalisation, displacement and conflict in Myanmar. Through this programme, Save the Children expects to reach in excess of 800,000 direct beneficiaries amongst a total catchment population of 1,600,000 persons in marginalised ethnic areas including Chin State, Sagaing Division, North Shan State, and Kayin State. The strategy is to ensure that targeted communities have access to a package of essential services through its proven approach to village level primary health care activities. Through a community-driven approach to meeting health needs, Merlin is also to introduce crucial elements of governance and accountability, into a range of different contexts, where at present opportunities for individual and community empowerment are limited. This approach will substantially focus upon enabling individuals, households and communities to make informed decisions about their health and treatment seeking behaviour, thus reducing the economic and social burden of diseases.
